meanings.definition: The quality or fact of being greater in number, quantity, or importance.
meanings.sent1: In the classroom, the preponderance of students preferred the color blue.
meanings.sent2: The preponderance of evidence supported the scientist's theory.
meanings.sent3: The preponderance of cookies in the jar made it impossible to resist grabbing one.
meanings.sent4: Her preponderance of kindness shone through in every interaction.
meanings.sent5: The preponderance of stars in the night sky took her breath away.

meanings.definition: A superiority in weight, power, importance, or strength.
meanings.sent1: The preponderance of the elephant made it impossible to move the heavy log.
meanings.sent2: His preponderance in the debate made it clear he was the most knowledgeable on the topic.
meanings.sent3: The preponderance of pillows on the bed made it look like a fluffy cloud.
meanings.sent4: Her preponderance in the gym class was evident as she effortlessly lifted the heavy weights.
meanings.sent5: The preponderance of the mountain loomed over the tiny village below.
